what: Import data from the web — fImport-package
title: Import data from the web — fImport-package
text: Rmetrics "fImport" package collection utility functions     download manage data sets Internet     sources.

title: Import data from the web — fImport-package
text: major content package provide download functions     financial market data Internet.     implemented web text browsers "Lynx", "Links", "W3M"     easy straightforward download data Internet. Furthermore helpful utility functions included split numerical     data matrices, split date character vectors, split strings     downloads. allows create easy way     timeSeries objects. Examples provided downloading data Federal Reserve     data base St. Louis web portal. data part contains instruments listings American Stock     Exchange, FED H15 Report, NASDAQ Stock Market,     New York Stock Exchange, OANDAs Foreign Exchange Rates,     STOXX Indices, Swiss Stock Exchange. download spread sheets Internet refer     functions gdata::read.xls xlsx::read.xlsx     contributed R packages gdata xlsx respectively.

title: Import data from the web — fImport-package
text: package makes functions available download financial market     data internet. Currently functions available     follwing web sites. functions :  economic financial time series data extracted objects     class "timeSeries".
code: fredSeries      downloads data from research.stlouisfed.org     fredImport      downloads data from research.stlouisfed.org

title: Import data from the web — fImport-package
text: package comes following tailored readers web     downloaders:
code: read.lines      a synonym function call to readLines     read.links      uses the links browser to read from a web page     read.lynx       uses the lynx browser to read from a web page     read.w3m        uses the w3m browser to read from a web page

title: Import data from the web — fImport-package
text: section provides functions split numerical data matrices,     split date character vectors, split strings     downloads:
code: dataSplit       splits a data matrix from a downloaded file     charvecSplit    splits a charvec vector from a downloaded file     stringSplit     splits a string vector from a downloaded file

title: Import data from the web — fImport-package
text: fImport Rmetrics package written educational     support teaching "Computational Finance Financial Engineering"     licensed GPL.

title: Class
text: class fWEBDATA represents time series downloaded   internet.

title: Class
text: Objects can created calls import series functions.

title: Class
text: call: Object class "call":       call applied function. data: Object class "data.frame":       downloaded data formatted "timeSeries" object. param: Object class "character":       character vector whose elements contain values selected       parameters argument list. title: Object class "character":       character string name download. can       overwritten specifying user defined input argument. description: Object class " character":       character string optional user defined description.       default just current date user test       applied returned.

title: Class
text: show signature(object = "fWEBDATA"):       prints object class 'fWEBDATA'.

title: Class
text: import series functions like fredImport   fredSeries typical examples show   implement download functions simple timeSeries objects   complicate fWEBDATA S4 objects. Inspect R code   feel free create download functions objects.

title: Class
text: Diethelm Wuertz, Yohan Chalabi, Andrew Ellis, (2010);   Financial Market Data R/Rmetrics,   Rmetrics eBook, Rmetrics Association Finance Online, Zurich,   www.rmetrics.org.

what: Import Market Data from the Federal Reserve Database — import-fred
title: Import Market Data from the Federal Reserve Database — import-fred
text: Imports financial time series data fred.stlouisfed.org.

title: Import Market Data from the Federal Reserve Database — import-fred
code: fredSeries(symbols, from = NULL, to = Sys.timeDate(),      nDaysBack = 366, ...)      fredImport(query, file = "tempfile", source = NULL, frequency = "daily",      from = NULL, to = Sys.timeDate(), nDaysBack = NULL,     save = FALSE, sep = ";", try = TRUE)

title: Import Market Data from the Federal Reserve Database — import-fred
text: symbols character string symbols downloaded. start date time series extract. end date data download, default current date. nDaysBack number days back. ... optional arguments passed fredImport. query character string, denoting location data     web site. file save downloaded data, character string filename,     usually extension ".csv". source character string setting URL source.  NULL,     URL set automatically default value. frequency character string, one "auto", "quarterly",     "monthly", "daily", defining frequency     data records.  needed import function fails     autodetect frequency time series dowwnloaded. save logical value, set TRUE downloaded data file     stored path file name specified string     file. default FALSE.  sep character value specifying column separator. try logical value, set TRUE Internet access checked.

title: Import Market Data from the Federal Reserve Database — import-fred
text: fredSeries, object class timeSeries. fredImport, object class fWEBDATA   following slots: @call function call. @data downloaded data object class "timeSeries". @param character vector whose elements contain values selected     parameters argument list. @title character string name download. can     overwritten specifying user defined input argument. @description character string optional user defined description.     default just current date test applied     returned.

title: Import Market Data from the Federal Reserve Database — import-fred
text: Internet Download Functions: IMPORTANT NOTE: service provider changes data file format   may become necessary modify update functions. Feel free inspect code functions create   download function Internet web sites Portals.

title: Import Market Data from the Federal Reserve Database — import-fred
text: Diethelm Wuertz Rmetrics R-port.

title: Import Market Data from the Federal Reserve Database — import-fred
text: Diethelm Wuertz, Yohan Chalabi, Andrew Ellis, (2010);     Financial Market Data R/Rmetrics,     Rmetrics eBook, Rmetrics Association Finance Online, Zurich,     www.rmetrics.org.

title: Import Market Data from the Federal Reserve Database — import-fred
code: # \donttest{ a <- fredImport("DEXSZUS") #> Loading required namespace: rvest head(a@data)  # a@data is a "timeSeries" object #> GMT  #>            DEXSZUS #> 1971-01-04  4.3180 #> 1971-01-05  4.3117 #> 1971-01-06  4.3113 #> 1971-01-07  4.3103 #> 1971-01-08  4.3109 #> 1971-01-11  4.3102  b <- fredSeries("DEXSZUS") head(b) # a "timeSeries" object #> GMT  #>      DEXSZUS # }

what: Read from a text file line by line — read-lines
title: Read from a text file line by line — read-lines
text: Reads text file line line. Wrapper readLines()     function.

title: Read from a text file line by line — read-lines
Read from a text file line by line — read-lines
text: con connection object character string. n integer, (maximal) number lines read.         Negative values indicate one read         end input connection. ok logical, OK reach end connection         n > 0 lines read? , error         generated. warn logical, warn text file missing final EOL.         default FALSE, note different function         readLines. encoding character string, encoding assumed input         strings.

text: Uses Links Text Browser read web page.

title: Links Browser interface — read-links
code: read.links(url, intern = TRUE, bin = NULL, pipe = FALSE, ...)

title: Links Browser interface — read-links
text: url character string specifying URL web page. intern logical indicates whether make output     command R object. bin string path lynx binary NULL lynx     binary available operating system path. pipe logical indicates whether result returned     pipe() commmand. ... optional arguments passed links binary.

title: Lynx Browser interface — read-lynx
text: url character string specifying URL web page. intern logical indicates whether make output     command R object. bin string path lynx binary NULL lynx     binary available operating system path. pipe logical indicates whether result returned     pipe() commmand. ... optional arguments passed lynx binary. example     accept_all_cookies = TRUE     cookie_file="~/.lynx_cookies". list options, see     lynx manual page.

title: Split downloaded data sets — utils-split
text: Helpful dataset charvec splitting utilities.

title: Split downloaded data sets — utils-split
code: dataSplit(x, split=" ", col=-1) charvecSplit(x, split=" ", col=1, format="%F") stringSplit(x, split=" ", col=NULL)

title: Split downloaded data sets — utils-split
text: x character vector splitted. split split character, default blank. col integer value vector, column(s) selected. format date format character vector, default         ISO-8601 date format.

title: Split downloaded data sets — utils-split
